title: Israel-Hamas war: Settlers speed up eviction of Palestinian Bedouins in West Bank hills amid war
summary: Hundreds of Palestinian Bedouins are being driven off their land in a displacement strategy orchestrated by Israeli settlers since 2017, which has been accelerating discreetly since October 7.

title: Avoiding the Hamas trap in Gaza
summary: Hamas is banking on the revolutionary unrest that a bloodbath in Gaza could spark off in Jordan, Egypt and the rest of the Arab world.

title: Emmanuel Macron will visit Israel on Tuesday to meet with Netanyahu
summary: US President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also agreed Sunday after a second aid convoy reached Gaza from Egypt that such assistance will continue, as Israel keeps attacking the Hamas-ruled territory, the White House said.

title: French government accused of 'stalling' on response to summer urban riots
summary: After postponing her announcement, Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne is due to present measures for working-class neighborhoods at the end of October.

title: Argentina: Economy Minister Sergio Massa and outsider Javier Milei head to runoff presidential election
summary: With 76% of the votes counted, Sergio Massa had 35.2%, compared to the anti-establishment candidate Javier Milei's 30.5%, meaning the two were poised to face off in a November second round.

title: In Kyiv, escapism via the big screen
summary: Despite the ongoing war, a film festival in the Ukrainian capital sold-out, offering audiences an escape from the harsh realities of everyday life.

title: Switzerland's right-wing Swiss People's Party dominates general election in early projections
summary: With more than half of the results in, the populist Swiss People's Party (SVP) took 29 percent of the vote in elections to the lower house of parliament, riding on a platform focused on immigration and opposition to 'woke culture.'

title: Joe Biden's credibility damaged by soaring budget deficit
summary: At a time when the United States is enjoying full employment and growth in excess of 2%, the real US budget deficit has doubled, although it is being obscured by an accounting maneuver that conceals the extent of its rise.

title: 'The Quran does not give carte blanche to commit  violence'
summary: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' eight Muslim academics, researchers and intellectuals, including the professor of social psychology Marwan Sinaceur at the ESSEC Business School, write why terrorism revolts them, and how contrary it is to Islam's values.

title: European cities hold vigils against antisemitism and rallies in support of Gaza relief
summary: Thousands of people rallied in Paris on Sunday demanding an end to the Israeli military operation in Gaza which organizers said was a 'massacre', following the bloody attack by Hamas militants.

title: Philippines summons China's ambassador over south China sea collisions
summary: Two collisions occurred on Sunday in the disputed Spratly Islands, near Second Thomas Shoal, a region where Beijing deploys its vessels to assert control over nearly the entire South China Sea.

title: UN Palestinian refugee agency reports 29 staff members killed in Gaza
summary: Thousands of Gazans have sought shelter at UNRWA facilities since Israel launched an aerial bombardment campaign in reprisal for Hamas attacks in Israel in which 1,400 people were killed.

title: Joaquin Phoenix and Rooney Mara may be a simple detail for you...
summary: But not for Marc Beaugé. On October 14, actor couple Joaquin Phoenix and Rooney Mara hosted a special screening for the documentary 'The Smell of Money' at a small venue in Santa Monica, with a costume budget worthy of independent cinema.

title: 'Adopting eco-friendly behavior also makes people happier!'
summary: Research into the economics of happiness shows that the incentive to 'do the right thing' is more effective than asking people to make sacrifices, said economist Francis Munier.

title: Iran sentences two female journalists who covered Mahsa Amini's death to prison
summary: A court in Iran sentenced Niloufar Hamedi, who broke the news of Amini's death for wearing her headscarf too loosely, and Elaheh Mohammadi, who wrote about her funeral, to seven and six years in jail, local reports said.

title: Tokyo's busy obliterating its charm with urban renewal
summary: A plan to cut down a thousand trees, including century-old ginkgoes, in the center of the Japanese capital is provoking fierce opposition.

title: Paris+ by Art Basel: Contemporary art's shining moment in the French capital
summary: Despite economic and international upheavals, the second edition of the Paris+ contemporary art fair opened in an optimistic atmosphere.

title: The story of the Gaza Strip, explained
summary: Home to 2.3 million Palestinians, Gaza, wedged between Israel, Egypt and the Mediterranean Sea, has been under blockade for 16 years. This unprecedented situation is the result of a turbulent history.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Cairo summit calls for humanitarian aid amid acute divisions between Europeans and Arabs
summary: The summit held in Egypt on Saturday failed to produce a joint declaration. Cairo denounced the West's 'incomprehensible hesitation' to condemn the deaths of Palestinian civilians under Israeli bombardment.

title: France's largest demonstration of solidarity with Palestine since start of war in Gaza goes off peacefully
summary: Organizers counted some 30,000 participants at the rally in Paris, the first authorized since the start of the war.

title: Despite numerous international commitments, deforestation still increased by 4% in 2022
summary: In addition to deforestation, the degradation of forest ecosystems due to the consequences of climate change and timber harvesting had a major impact.

title: What is the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, Hamas' unpredictable radical ally?
summary: Israel has accused the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) of being behind the rocket attack that caused an explosion at Al-Ahli hospital. The second largest armed movement in the Gaza Strip maintains an uncompromising stance in its armed struggle against Israel and is also expanding its influence in the West Bank.

title: 1$ trillion in 2022: Multinationals continue shifting their profits to tax havens
summary: Despite an agreement on a global minimum corporate tax, multinational companies still transfer significant profits to tax havens, according to an EU Tax Observatory report.

title: Assemblée Nationale president accuses Mélenchon of putting 'target on my back' after Israel visit
summary: Yaël Braun-Pivet, the president of France's Assemblée Nationale, denounced the words used by left-wing leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon to criticize her visit to Israel following the attacks by Hamas.

title: Argentina: Peronist candidate Sergio Massa holds back the far-right wave
summary: In Sunday's first round of the Argentinian presidential election, the center-left coalition candidate, Sergio Massa, beat the outsider Javier Milei. They will compete in a second round on November 19.

title: Michel Duclos, former French ambassador: 'In a world without rules, all frozen conflicts risk erupting'
summary: Noting that the use of force is no longer taboo, the former diplomat argues for an acceleration of dialogue between the Global North and South in order to strengthen global security.

title: Roshdi Sarraj, Palestinian journalist and fixer, killed by Israeli strike in Gaza
summary: The 31-year-old worked for the press and international NGOs for over ten years, including with Le Monde. Nearly 20 journalists have been killed in Gaza since October 7.

title: Keeping up the pressure to combat tax evasion
summary: Going forward, multinational companies will pay a minimum tax rate of 15% regardless of where they declare profits. This is far from perfect, but it is a clear step in restoring equity to a system that governments have let slide for too long.

title: American autoworkers union expands strike, shuts down Stellantis plant
summary: United Auto Workers has been on strike since September 15, shutting down Ford, General Motors, and Stellantis factories, and has received President Biden's support.

title: France announces sale of weapons to Armenia
summary: Yerevan has agreed to purchase radar systems from the French group Thales amid fears that Azerbaijan might seek to target southern Armenia, after having seized Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: Macron to call for 'resumption of a genuine peace process' on Israel visit
summary: The French president will call for the 'resumption of a genuine peace process' for the creation of a Palestinian state during his visit, during which he will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Risk of regional escalation raises tension on Israel-Lebanon border
summary: Israel has begun evacuating several communities in the area, while deploying tanks and carrying out air strikes. On the other side, Hezbollah has mobilized tens of thousands of men and is firing rockets and shells. One slip, one misfire, could start a fire that both sides would prefer to avoid.

title: UN General Assembly to meet over Israel-Hamas war on Thursday
summary: The Security Council has so far failed to agree on a resolution concerning the war.

title: UN departs new base in Mali's tense Kidal region
summary: The UN's withdrawal on Monday is the second in the Kidal region and the seventh in the country.
